document.docAuthor: Liang, Ai-Ping, Song, Zhi-Shun & Jiang, Guo-Mei
document.masterDocTitle: Sphenocratus xinjiangensis Liang, sp. nov., the first authentic record of the dictyopharid subfamily Orgeriinae (Hemiptera: Fulgoroidea: Dictyopharidae) in China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Sphenocratus xinjiangensis Liang, sp. nov., the first authentic record of the dictyopharid subfamily Orgeriinae (Hemiptera: Fulgoroidea: Dictyopharidae) in China

subSubSection.paragraph: Male, brachypterous, nymphlike, length (from apex of cephalic process to tip of genitalia) 3.32–3.52 mm; length of head 0.69–0.72 mm, width (including eyes) 1.09–1.16 mm; length of fore wings 1.70 mm. General color ochraceous, marked with fuscous or brown.

caption.paragraph:

Liang
,
sp. nov.
(China: Xinjiang, IZCAS): male, dorsal habitus.

FIGURES 2–10.
Sphenocratus xinjiangensis Liang
,
sp. nov.
(China: Xinjiang, IZCAS): 2. head (ventral view). 3. head and pronotum (lateral view). 4. left fore wing. 5. genitalia (lateral view). 6. pygofer and parameres (ventral view). 7. pygofer and anal tube (dorsal view). 8. aedeagus (ventral view). 10. aedeagus (lateral view). 11. aedeagus (dorsal view).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype
: male, Northwestern China : Xinjiang Autonomous Region, Tuoli,
20 .VI. 1955
(S.­J. Ma, K.­L. Xia & Y.­L. Chen) ( IZCAS ).
Paratype
.
1 male
, Northwestern China : same data as holotype ( IZCAS ).

Northwestern China (Xinjiang). The discovery of this species in Xinjiang Autonomous Region in northwestern China has extended the range of the genus
Sphenocratus
and the subfamily Orgeriinae southeastward considerably.

This species is related to
S. megacephalus (
Oshanin, 1879
)
from Turkestan but can be distinguished from the latter by its distinctly smaller body size and by the minutiae of the male genitalia, especially the aedeagus with the phalli with 2 or 3 spinelike processes on the apical, inner edge of the forked arms (
Figs. 5, 8 , 10
) (also see
Mityaev 2002
,
Fig.
4
–17– 19 ).
